name: politico
text:
House Democrats are swiftly lining up support for their policing reform package, including among their most moderate members.

Top Dems now expect to secure 216 supporters — the number of votes needed for passage on the floor — by the end of the week 
https://t.co/WKvzdsAvKE

name: politico
text:
NASCAR banned the Confederate flag from its races and properties today, formally distancing itself from what for many is a symbol of slavery and racism that had been a familiar sight at stock car events for more than 70 years

https://t.co/Si6DTwMFG9

name: politico
text:
Jon Ossoff has won the nomination to take on Republican Sen. David Perdue in Georgia

https://t.co/vFYG7Bz15W

name: politico
text:
Ossoff had 51% of the vote when the AP called the race with more than 888,000 votes counted, narrowly topping the 50% threshold necessary to avoid a runoff. 

His closest rival, former Columbus Mayor Teresa Tomlinson, had 15% https://t.co/46aHMCxd5V https://t.co/Jo1nJhuVd3

name: politico
text:
The need for digestible facts has never been greater. Your time has never been more valuable. Listen to POLITICO Dispatch, a daily podcast that provides short, reliable and critical news you need. Subscribe today.
https://t.co/DPUpEFlsul https://t.co/ZdkHEBje5S

name: politico
text:
Amazon said today it will pause police use of its facial recognition software for one year, a move that comes amid rising scrutiny of law enforcement surveillance of activists protesting the killing of George Floyd while in police custody

https://t.co/MlxBdvx3NV

name: politico
text:
The coronavirus is spiking in more than a dozen states and intensive care beds are filling again, but several governors have no plans to reimpose shutdown measures or pause reopenings

https://t.co/PwV2lMN5pU

name: politico
text:
Opinion: If Trump loses in November, it will mostly be because he took his presidency and needlessly drove into the ground, 280 characters at a time.

https://t.co/Hfm4aIYdDO

name: politico
text:
Mike Pompeo on Wednesday addressed the State Department workforce about the fallout from the death of George Floyd, saying U.S. diplomats can tell an “extraordinary” story about how America responds to such tragedies when compared to places less free

https://t.co/SW40r8w0KJ

name: politico
text:
Countries like Australia and South Korea have launched smartphone apps to track the spread of coronavirus.

But U.S. efforts to do the same are running into an all-too-familiar problem that has plagued the pandemic response: a lack of national coordination
https://t.co/P0WChPySCQ

name: politico
text:
The U.S. shed 585,000 government jobs last month almost entirely at the state and local level, even as the rest of the economy started to show signs of recovery

https://t.co/zqtkIo4VPP

name: politico
text: The United States has surpassed 2 million coronavirus cases as the outbreak spikes in numerous states https://t.co/AFxpgFOM1D

name: politico
text: A deep partisan divide over in-person vs. mail-in balloting became clear during Tuesday’s troubled election in Georgia as well as Wisconsin’s controversial April 7 primary https://t.co/LjfbVmq4vT

name: politico
text: Senate Democrats are voicing deep skepticism toward the GOP’s newfound embrace of police reform https://t.co/XXMZv3HDDj

name: politico
text: The fall of Confederate statues is giving rise to a new type of progressivism https://t.co/SF3mCl6vMU
